Package ohos.media.image

Class ImageSource.DecodingOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.media.image.ImageSource.DecodingOptions
  • Enclosing class:
    ImageSource

    public static class ImageSource.DecodingOptions
extends Object
    Provides image decoding options.

    The options include the pixel format, color space, and parameters for cropping, scaling, and rotating an image.

    Since:
    1

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      AllocatorType allocator
      Indicates the memory allocation type for decoded image data.
      boolean allowPartialImage
      Indicates whether to allow partial image decoding.

      Indicates the default sampling size.

      Indicates the color space of a decoded image, which is defined by ColorSpace.

      Indicates the pixel format of a decoded image, which is defined by PixelFormat.
      Rect desiredRegion
      Indicates an image area to be decoded.
      Size desiredSize
      Indicates the expected output size.
      boolean editable
      Specifies whether pixel values of the pixel map to be decoded can be edited.
      int fitDensity
      Indicates the pixel density of the decoded image.
      float rotateDegrees
      Indicates the rotation angle, ranging from 0 to 360.
      int sampleSize
      Indicates the sampling size based on which an image is scaled down.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_SAMPLE_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_SAMPLE_SIZE
        Indicates the default sampling size.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • allocator

        public AllocatorType allocator
        Indicates the memory allocation type for decoded image data.
        Since:
        4

      • allowPartialImage

        public boolean allowPartialImage
        Indicates whether to allow partial image decoding.

        When this option is set to false and an incomplete image is partially decoded, the decoding fails.

        Since:
        1

      • desiredColorSpace

        public ColorSpace desiredColorSpace
        Indicates the color space of a decoded image, which is defined by ColorSpace.

        If this color space is supported, the decoder will decode the image to one with this color space. Otherwise, the decoder will select the most suitable color space for the image.

        Since:
        1

      • desiredPixelFormat

        public PixelFormat desiredPixelFormat
        Indicates the pixel format of a decoded image, which is defined by PixelFormat.

        If this format is supported, the decoder will decode the image to the target format. Otherwise, the decoder will select the most suitable format for the image.

        Since:
        1

      • desiredRegion

        public Rect desiredRegion
        Indicates an image area to be decoded.

        If area decoding is not supported, the entire image is decoded and then cropped with a rectangle. The area to be decoded is specified based on the original image instead of an edited image.

        Since:
        1

      • desiredSize

        public Size desiredSize
        Indicates the expected output size.

        If the opted size is different from the original image size, the image is output after being scaled up or down. If both sampleSize and this option are set, this option prevails. This vairable specifies the final size of an output image. If this variable, desiredRegion, and rotateDegress are all set, the expected image area will be decoded, rotated, and then scaled to the expected size.

        Since:
        1

      • editable

        public boolean editable
        Specifies whether pixel values of the pixel map to be decoded can be edited. Value true means that the values can be edited, and false means the opposite. The default value is false.
        Since:
        4

      • fitDensity

        public int fitDensity
        Indicates the pixel density of the decoded image.
        Since:
        4

      • rotateDegrees

        public float rotateDegrees
        Indicates the rotation angle, ranging from 0 to 360. An image is rotated clockwise with the original image center as the rotation center.
        Since:
        1

      • sampleSize

        public int sampleSize
        Indicates the sampling size based on which an image is scaled down. For example, if the value is 2, both the width and height of the image are scaled down to half of the original. The value must be an integer, 1 or greater.
        Since:
        1

      • DecodingOptions

        public DecodingOptions​()
